author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bridge operator, who noticed the mishap, immediately alerted the officials

Madurai-Rameswaram Passenger train was held up at Mandapam railway station for about 80 minutes on Tuesday night after a mechanised fishing boat, anchored in the north side sea, moved away as the rope got snapped and rammed into Scherzer’s span of Pamban rail bridge.

The train, which left Madurai at 6.05 p.m. on Tuesday had reached Mandapam station at 9.05 p.m. when the fishing trawler anchored on the north side of the sea drifted after the rope got snapped and crashed into the span, sources in Railway Protection Force (RPF) said.

The bridge operator, who noticed the freak mishap, immediately alerted the officials, after which the train was detained at Mandapam station.

The Senior Section Engineer (SSR) from Pamban and the Seaway SSR from Mandapam inspected the bridge and found that the mishap had not caused any damaged to the bridge or the span.

When they gave the clearance, the train was allowed to pass through the bridge after a delay of 80 minutes, the sources said.

The boat owner had been identified as R. Abson (55) of Thangachimadam.

The RPF would register a case against him after consulting higher officials, the sources said.

Meanwhile, the Southern Railway Principal Chief Engineer inspected the bridge while travelling on Madurai-Rameswaram Passenger on Wednesday evening. He would travel by road from Rameswaram and inspect the opening of Scherzer’s span on Thursday from the road bridge.

The inspection was decided one week ago and had nothing to do with the Tuesday night’s mishap, sources added.
title: Boat rams Pamban bridge; train held up
